title: Ticket #1232: batch_test.pl should support non-perl tests
description:
batch_test.pl launches tests with the command "perl $testprogram". This has the advantage that the program will start even if perl isn't in the location specified in the #! line, or if the operating system doesn't respect #! at all (Windows). However, it means we can't ever add a, say, Python test.

Proposal: Wrap the launch in a wrapper that sniffs the file and calls the appropriate interpreter (or maybe even runs a native binary directly). Start with Perl support, add others as the need arises. Unsupported should cause the test to fail with a clear message. "Could not identify interpreter for test foo.run; appears to want '#! /bin/sh'"
